text: Motoujina-guchi is a Hiroden station (tram stop) on Hiroden Ujina Line, located in Minami-ku, Hiroshima. ==Routes== From Motoujina-guchi Station, there are three of Hiroden Streetcar routes. *25px Hiroshima Station - Hiroshima Port Route *25px Hiroden-nishi-hiroshima - Hiroshima Port Route *25px Hiroshima Station - (via Hijiyama-shita) - Hiroshima Port Route ==Connections== ;█ Ujina Line :25px 25px 25px ::Kaigan-dori — Motoujina-guchi — Hiroshima Port ==Around station== *Moto-Ujina Park *Hiroshima Minato Park ==History== *Opened as "Mukōujina-guchi" on April 3, 1915. *Moved and renamed to "2-chome-ura" in 1929. *Renamed to "Mukōujina" as the terminal stop on December 27, 1935. *Renamed to "Mukōujina-guchi". *Renamed to the present name "Motoujina-guchi" on November 1, 2001. ==See also== *Hiroden Streetcar Lines and Routes *List of railway stations in Japan ==External links== Motoujina- guchi Station Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1915
title: Motoujina-guchi Station
